definition: lit. contribute bricks and tiles for a building (idiom)/fig. to do one's bit to help
abbr. for Canada 加拿大[Jia1 na2 da4]/surname Jia

to add/plus/(used after an adverb such as 不, 大, 稍 etc, and before a disyllabic verb, to indicate that the action of the verb is applied to sth or sb previously mentioned)/to apply (restrictions etc) to (sb)/to give (support, consideration etc) to (sth)
roof tile/abbr. for 瓦特[wa3 te4]

sentences.english: Adding to the language's standard functionality was very difficult.
sentences.chinese: 要爲這個語言的標準功能添磚加瓦簡直是難如登天。

sentences.english: Knowledge is a city, to the building of which every human being brought a stone.
sentences.chinese: 知識是座城宇，人人都應爲之添磚加瓦。

sentences.english: You want to know how you can grease the process in your favor.
sentences.chinese: 你會想知道怎樣才能給面試的效果添磚加瓦。

sentences.english: We have a good foundation but we need to build on it.
sentences.chinese: 我們有不錯的基礎，但還需要添磚加瓦。
